meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of a showman.
meanings.sent1: He presented his magic tricks showmanly, with flair and excitement.
meanings.sent2: The circus performer walked showmanly across the tightrope, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent3: The magician showmanly pulled a rabbit out of his hat, much to the delight of the children.
meanings.sent4: The auctioneer's fast-talking style was showmanly, drawing in bidders with each word.
meanings.sent5: The actor delivered his lines showmanly, commanding attention on stage.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a showman.

meanings.sent2: The circus tent had a showmanly atmosphere, filled with bright lights and lively music.
meanings.sent3: The showmanly smile of the magician hinted at the surprises to come during the performance.
meanings.sent4: Her showmanly gestures on stage added to the excitement of the magic show.
meanings.sent5: The showmanly voice of the announcer boomed through the arena, announcing the next act.
